curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit/Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Agent learns the fundamental decisions of hitting or standing. The focus is on understanding when to take a card and when to avoid busting. Dealer hits on 16 and stands on 17. No splitting or doubling down allowed.

curriculum_stages.name: Advanced Hit/Stand - Dealer's Upcard
curriculum_stages.description: Agent learns to adjust hit/stand decisions based on the dealer's upcard. This requires the agent to estimate the likelihood of the dealer busting or making a strong hand. Still no splitting or doubling down.

curriculum_stages.name: Adding Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: Agent learns when to use the 'Double Down' action. This stage builds upon the previous stages, requiring the agent to assess the hand strength and the potential reward of doubling the bet in advantageous situations. Dealer hits on 16 and stands on 17. No splitting allowed.

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack with Splitting
curriculum_stages.description: Agent learns to play full blackjack, including splitting pairs. This is the most complex stage, requiring the agent to evaluate the best action in all situations, including those where splitting can lead to a significant advantage. Dealer hits on 16 and stands on 17.
